Question
========
  
A teacher wants to know if the current group of first-year students is performing better than last year's freshmen. She does this by comparing the average in a randomly drawn sample of current freshmen to the average grade of all students who were freshmen last year. What is the smallest sample size at which the teacher can compare with a power of at least 90% and a $\alpha$ = .05 can note an improvement of 0.2 over last year? Here is $\sigma$ = 0.8. 
Answerlist
----------
* 90
* 135
* 140
* 215
